result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Elton L Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen M Compton in court for Elton L Smith.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Request to cancel jury trial. Speedy trial demand withdrawn. Motion to suppress 10/7 filed response by 10/28. Minutes filed.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defense Letter to Judge re: trial set, motion to suppress, speedy demand withdrawal

Defendant in court in custody via video with attorney Steve Compton. ADA Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Matter on for Final Pre Trial for 22CF186. Other matters tracking 22CF429 and TRs.  Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved on 22CF429.  ADA Herrmann spoke with lab and results should in next week. State confirming for trial, witnesses prepared. One witness only available one day so needs 2 days. Discovery complete. Atty Compton ready to proceed for trial. Court confirms for trial, speedy, 2 days. Newer case to track along with trial dates. Parties to advise court if any thing changes. Court in recess at 1108 am.
3:04 PM (64-06) Defendant Elton L Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Stephen M Compton in court for Elton L Smith.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Elton L Smith in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Stephen M Compton in court for Elton L Smith. Speedy demand made on the case. Minutes filed.
Further proceedings scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

Defendant Elton L Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by James Sempf.  Attorney Jason Daane specially for  Stephen M Compton in court for Elton L Smith. Called @ 2:17 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for bond hearing on new charges in 22GF744 with 22CF186 on for further proceedings. Record by Atty. Daane as to new charges. Defendant is represented by Atty. Compton on 22CF186 and will be appointed on new charges. Record by the State as to bond - State has no objection to the bond in 22CF186 covering new charges in 22GF744.  

Court orders bond in 22CF186 to cover 22GF744.  Court date of 8/10/2022 @ 1:15 for case number 22CF186 remains. New GF file set for same date/time.

Court in recess.

Defendant Elton L Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by JJ Crawford.  Attorney Stephen M Compton in court for Elton L Smith. Called @ 3:11 pm. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 2nd status with 22TR1074 and 22TR1075 tracking. Record by Atty. Compton as to status, discovery. Atty. just retained and asks for additional status to come up to speed on the matter. Demand for speedy trial entered. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Elton L Smith in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Stephen M Compton in court for Elton L Smith. Attorney Compton taking over the case. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Elton L Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Atty. Vivien TenHaken.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for Elton L Smith. Called @ 1:28 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court on motion to modify bond. Record by Atty. Daane as to his motion, and response to further questions of the Court. Response by the Court who denies motion to modify bond. Future court dates remain as scheduled. Court in recess.

Defendant Elton L Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for Elton L Smith.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 2:07 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for preliminary hearing. Parties are ready to proceed.
2:08 p.m. - State calls Deputy Daniel Nichols who is duly sworn by the Clerk and responds to direct examination of Atty. Herrmann. Exhibit #1, marked, identified, and testified to by witness. State moves exhibit #1 into evidence. No objection. Exhibit received.
2:10 p.m. - Cross examination by Atty. Daane.
2:15 p.m. - Witness excused. Evidence closed. Argument by the State. Argument by Atty. Daane.
2:16 p.m. Court binds defendant over for trial. State asks for a couple of weeks to file information. Atty. Daane asks for date for bond motion next week. State asks for arraignment in 3 weeks. 
Court sets as indicated.
Motion hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Arraignment scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND COVERS 22CF186 & 22GF744(22-3380)
Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-1490 thru 22-1492

James Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Elton Lenard Smith in court, in custody by video with Attorney Mackenzie Renner. Defendant does not qualify for SPD attorney if released. Defendant is employed through temp agency. Right to attorney options form given. Minutes filed.
